page.title: 16MORRIS DANCING-WALES VILLAGE
page.content: {Morris Dancers}dance to folk music. There used to be a Morris team for every town. Now there are not so many Luckily Wales village has a team,"The Lord Conyer's Morris Men". They practise once a week, usually at Wales Chapel.All the dancers are male. On May Day morning they get up at 5.00 am.to dance all around South Yorkshire. In the team there is a "bagman", who writes the programme,and a "fool" who messes around and teases the dancers.There is a "horse" who dances but also goes round with a hat to collect money from spectators.The Morris Men say, "He is a retired pit pony who is nine pence short of a 'bob'." The Morris Men aren't paid for dancing.Traditionally Morris dancing was thought to make a special magic which was meant to waken the plants of spring.
